movies.title: Then I Sentenced Them All to Death
movies.originalTitle: Atunci i-am condamnat pe toti la moarte
movies.plot: During World War II, just before the events of August 23rd 1944, a German soldier is found murdered in a Romanian village. The dead soldier's superior threatens the villagers that unless the perpetrator is handed over by the following morning they will all face reprisals. In order to avoid this, the village intellectuals try to convince Ipu, the village idiot, to take the blame for the murder and save them.
movies.simplePlot: In order to avoid reprisals from the Wehrmacht for the murder of a soldier, intellectuals from a Romanian village try to convince Ipu, the village idiot, to take the blame for the murder and save everybody.

biography.bio: Amza Pellea was born on April 7, 1931 in Bailesti, Dolj, Romania. He was an actor and writer, known for Michael the Brave (1970), Uncle Marin, the Billionaire (1979) and The Punishment (1976). He died on December 12, 1983 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Amza Pellea

biography.bio: Cristian Sofron was born on May 9, 1958 in Bucharest, Romania. He is an actor, known for Then I Sentenced Them All to Death (1972), Toate pînzele sus (1976) and 15 (2005).
biography.name: Cristian Sofron

biography.bio: Ion Besoiu was born on March 11, 1931 in Sibiu, Sibiu, Romania. He was an actor, known for Michael the Brave (1970), Bucharest Non Stop (2015) and Toate pînzele sus (1976). He died on January 18, 2017 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Ion Besoiu

biography.bio: Gheorghe Dinica is one of the greatest Romanian actors of all time. As a child he was passionate to go to movie theaters where he saw famous movie legends as Stan & Bran, Greta Garbo, Vivien Leigh, Bette Davis, Bill Crosby and Chaplin. From the age of 17 until 23 he was a part of different amateur theater troupes and in 1957, at the age of 23, he entered at The National Institute of Art Theatre and Cinematography. He captured public attention in 1961, in his last play for the exam where he played Inspector Gool from the play with the same name. His most well-known movies are Mastodontul (1975), Through the Ashes of the Empire (1976), Revenge (1978), Why Are the Bells Ringing, Mitica? (1981), The Contest (1982), The Stone Cross (1993), The Earth's Most Beloved Son (1993), Philanthropy (2002), Taxi or Limousine (2003), Sweet swan of death (2003) and in 2004 there are few movie in production or ready to be released, such as Orient Express and Magnatul. The rich filmography together with a full and successful experience in theatre makes him a respectable actor with a lot of fans even amongst the young generation and serve as an example for actors of his generation but also for the young ones.
biography.name: Gheorghe Dinica

biography.bio: Ioana Bulca was born on January 7, 1933 in Craiova, Dolj, Romania. She is an actress, known for Michael the Brave (1970), The Rest is Silence (2007) and Le moulin de la chance (1957).
biography.name: Ioana Bulca

biography.bio: Octavian Cotescu was born on February 14, 1931 in Dorohoi, Botosani, Romania. He was an actor, known for Operation Monster (1976), Saltimbancii (1981) and Circus Performers at the North Pole (1984). He died on August 22, 1985 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Octavian Cotescu

biography.placeOfBirth: Vadul Rosu, Soroca county, Romania [now Republic of Moldova]
biography.bio: Iurie Darie was born on March 14, 1929 in Vadul Rosu, Soroca county, Romania. He was an actor, known for Rautaciosul adolescent (1969), Dragoste la zero grade (1964) and B.D. in alert (1971). He was married to Anca Pandrea. He died on November 9, 2012 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Iurie Darie

biography.bio: Klára Sebök was born on August 15, 1942 in Vlãhita, Romania. She is an actress, known for Michael the Brave (1970), Then I Sentenced Them All to Death (1972) and Single-handed (1974).
biography.name: Klára Sebök

biography.bio: Stefan Mihailescu-Braila was born on February 3, 1925 in Braila, Braila, Romania. He was an actor, known for Uncle Marin, the Billionaire (1979), The Secret of Bacchus (1984) and Fiul muntilor (1981). He died on February 3, 1996 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Stefan Mihailescu-Braila

biography.bio: Eugenia Bosânceanu was born on February 8, 1925 in Radauti-Prut, Romania. She is an actress, known for 4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days (2007), L'occident (2002) and Médaille d'honneur (2009).
biography.name: Eugenia Bosânceanu

biography.bio: Eliza Petrachescu was born on June 15, 1911 in Vaslui, Romania. She was an actress, known for Lust for Gold (1974), Stone Wedding (1973) and Memories of My Childhood (1965). She died on March 4, 1977 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Eliza Petrachescu

biography.bio: Sergiu Nicolaescu was born on the 13th of April 1930, in Targu Jiu, Gorj County, Romania. Nicolaescu, the 'Steven Spielberg of the Romanian cinema', was a brilliant, self-taught technician and a master of popular entertainment who approached during his long career various genres with great success. In his childhood, he spent a lot of time at the cinema. He was inspired by the films and played "war" or "mystery" games with 30 fellow kids in the suburbs of his native town. His father was an engineer, who worked for King Michael. Therefore, after the King's abdication in 1947, his father was arrested. After finishing high school, Nicolaescu was accepted by three colleges. He finally attended the Romanian Marine Corps. Nicolaescu entered the realm of cinema by chance. A friend offered him a job in the Bucharest Studios of that time. He didn't expect a career in directing, but his poetic short film The Memory of the Rose (1964) got a lot of attention at the 1962 Cannes International Film Festival. In 1967, his massive domestic success The Dacians (1966) became the first Romanian hit film in Western Europe. Subsequently, Nicolaescu was internationally appreciated as a film director of large scale period films. He had the privilege to work in France, Germany and other countries on several projects in the 70s and 80s. He directed Michael the Brave (1970) and Then I Sentenced Them All to Death (1972), two of the most successful and best Romanian epics. He also was responsible for such indigenous blockbusters as The Immortals (1974),Cu mâinile curate (1972),Noi, cei din linia întîi (1985) and Proud Heritage (1989). His only, but very popular, comedy Uncle Marin, the Billionaire (1979) sold a record 14.6 mill. tickets in Romania, more than any other film in communist Romania. After the Romanian Revolution in Dec. 1989, Nicolaescu became a political figure, but continued to direct movies. Without the free assistance of the Romanian military, he couldn't produce epics as he did back in the Communist era. Oglinda (1994) and The Death Triangle (1999) were smaller in scale, but well-received at the box-office. While most of his epic films were only possible within the nationalist context of Communist Romania, they are still appreciated today by audiences as timeless, spectacular entertainments on a massive scale. One of his fans included director Steven Spielberg himself, who even included clips from a battle scene in "Mihai Viteazul" into E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982).
biography.name: Sergiu Nicolaescu

biography.bio: Alexandru Herescu is an actor, known for Michael the Brave (1970), The Dacians (1966) and Dragostea începe vineri (1974).
biography.name: Alexandru Herescu

biography.bio: Ernest Maftei was born on March 6, 1920 in Bacau, Bacau, Romania. He was an actor, known for The Punishment (1976), Vlad Tepes (1979) and Dumbrava minunata (1981). He died on October 19, 2006 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Ernest Maftei

biography.bio: Lazar Vrabie was born on August 25, 1924 in Bucharest, Romania. He was an actor, known for Mingea (1959), The Waves of the Danube (1959) and Babusca's Adventures (1973). He died on May 14, 1974 in Bucharest.
biography.name: Lazar Vrabie
